dct_title_s: Jobi Ludolfi Habessinia seu Abassia Presbyteri Johannis Regio perperam dicta, ad exemplum Tab. Chorographicæ P. Balth. Tellezii quanta fieri potuit formata correctis multis nominibus male scriptis: plurimisque locis passim insertis ex Gregorii Habess: fidâ relationa, illorum situ non ubiq. æque certo
dct_alternative_sm: Habessinia seu Abassia Presbyteri Johannes Regio
dct_description_sm: Christianus Ludolfus filius delineavit ex autographio parentis.
Map of Ethiopia and its surrounding areas.
Latitudinal and longitudinal lines along margins.
Decorative cartouches, compass rose, Royal insignia for the Emperor of Abyssinia on the upper left of the map with the Lion of Judah.
Pictorial vignettes of encampments, figures, flora, fauna (e.g. lions, elephants, rhinoceros), ships.
Appears in Ludolf's A new history of Ethiopia, Frankfurt am Main, 1683.
